Therefore, this property is to be taken over by you today with all the full rights that I have in the property. Therefore, from now on, you, your son, grandson, descendants, relatives, friends, and all the rights of donation, exchange, exchange, and sale of this property, including the water, water, treasure, and deposits, shall be freely enjoyed by you and your children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. Neither you nor your heirs nor your successors nor I nor my heirs nor my successors shall ever have any dispute about this property. Whenever, from whomsoever, whatever kind of taxes may be incurred, whatever obstacles may arise, I will avoid them all at my own expense and carry out this transaction without fail.

sections.content:
The property covered under Sale Deed No. 9624  of 2004, dated 28/Oct/2004, executed by Pujari Nageswara Rao, in favour of Chigurupalli Ashok Kumar Represented by his father Chigurupalli Peddiraju, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 66 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 6-114, comprised in survey number 196/12, situated in Kovvali Village & Grama Panchayati, Denduluru Mandal, Erstwhile West Godavari Now within the District of Eluru, registered at sub-registrar office Eluru (R.O), is bounded as follows:

North by: Site Of Muddada Kanakamma – Ft 31.6
South by: Site Of Budumuri Appa Rao – Ft 29.3
East by: Site Of Pujari Nageswara Rao – Ft 20
West by: Road – Ft 19.3
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is pertinent to note that Chigurupalli Ashok Kumar was a minor at the time of the deed's registration, and court permission should have been obtained before executing the deed. Furthermore, due to the passage of time and the expiration of the limitation period, it is opined that no legal claim may arise on Their behalf. Hence we are proceeding with the report on this pretext. However, it is, advisable for F.I. to verify her age using a government-issued proof of age document. Further It is observed from the EC that the party names are reflected twice. Hence, the F.I. is required to verify the same and obtain an updated EC. Further It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
